Assessment.short_description: The systematic process of documenting and evaluating knowledge, skills, attitudes, and competencies against defined criteria to make informed judgments about learning, performance, or capabilities.

Evaluation.short_description: The comprehensive analysis and interpretation of assessment data to make value judgments about the quality, worth, or effectiveness of learning, programs, or outcomes.

Measurement.short_description: The process of assigning numerical values or quantitative indicators to attributes, abilities, or performances according to standardized rules and procedures.

Criterion.short_description: The specific standard, benchmark, or reference point against which performance or achievement is measured and evaluated.

Rubric.short_description: A structured scoring guide that defines levels of performance or proficiency for specific criteria, providing detailed descriptions of quality at each level.

Validity.short_description: The extent to which an assessment accurately measures what it claims to measure, encompassing content, construct, and criterion-related evidence.

Reliability.short_description: The consistency and stability of assessment results across different occasions, raters, or versions, indicating the dependability of measurements.

Formative Assessment.short_description: Ongoing evaluation process used to monitor learning progress and provide immediate feedback for improving teaching and learning strategies.

Summative Assessment.short_description: End-point evaluation used to measure achievement of learning outcomes and make final judgments about performance or competency levels.

Diagnostic Assessment.short_description: Pre-learning evaluation to identify baseline knowledge, skills gaps, or learning needs before instruction begins.

Portfolio.short_description: Curated collection of evidence demonstrating learning progress, achievements, and competencies over time through selected artifacts and reflections.

Performance Assessment.short_description: Direct evaluation of complex skills or competencies through authentic tasks, demonstrations, or real-world applications.

Standardization.short_description: The process of ensuring uniform conditions, procedures, and scoring criteria for assessment administration and interpretation.

Calibration.short_description: The alignment of raters or evaluators to ensure consistent interpretation and application of assessment criteria and standards.

Benchmark.short_description: Reference point or standard of performance used to compare and evaluate achievement levels across individuals or groups.

Outcome.short_description: Specific, measurable result or demonstration of learning that indicates achievement of educational or performance goals.

Indicator.short_description: Observable and measurable evidence that demonstrates progress toward or achievement of specific outcomes or standards.

Metric.short_description: Quantitative measure or parameter used to track, evaluate, and compare performance or progress over time.

Artifact.short_description: Tangible evidence or product that demonstrates learning, skill development, or achievement of specific outcomes.

Moderation.short_description: Quality assurance process of reviewing and adjusting assessment judgments to ensure consistency and fairness across different contexts.

Authentication.short_description: Process of verifying the identity and originality of assessment work to ensure integrity and prevent academic misconduct.

Feedback.short_description: Information provided about performance or understanding to guide improvement and support learning progression.

Norm.short_description: Statistical reference point derived from the performance of a defined population, used for comparative interpretation of scores.

Scale.short_description: Systematic framework for measuring and recording performance levels or achievement across defined dimensions.

Competency.short_description: Integrated set of knowledge, skills, and abilities required to perform specific tasks or functions to defined standards.

Proficiency.short_description: Demonstrated level of skill or knowledge mastery measured against established performance standards or criteria.

Analytics.short_description: Systematic analysis of assessment data to identify patterns, trends, and insights for improving learning and performance outcomes.

Accommodation.short_description: Modification to assessment conditions or procedures to ensure fair access and demonstration of ability for diverse learners.

Objectivity.short_description: Degree to which assessment judgments are free from personal bias and based on clear, measurable criteria.

Fairness.short_description: Principle ensuring all individuals have equitable opportunity to demonstrate their abilities without disadvantage or bias.
